result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan Antione Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryan Antione Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Bryan Antione Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Defense counsel has been unable to meet with defendant and requests adjourned plea and sentencing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Bryan Antione Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Bryan Antione Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Calendar Call. Parties provide an update to the court. Court withdraws previous stayed bench warrant. Defense counsel requests a Plea/Sentencing Hearing, due to reasons put forth on the record. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 8-1-2022

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Josh Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Calendar call scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Bryan Antione Johnson in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Bryan Antione Johnson in custody.  Nate Mcclure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  
This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with TC, dob 1/7/2003
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
